qas.question: Who takes care of roads and sanitation in Cork?
How many wards make up Cork?
What is the most well represented ward in Cork?
Which party has the least amount of members?
How is a mayor chosen in Cork?

answers.text: vote by the elected members of the council under a D'Hondt system count

qas.question: What government has more power than in other countries?
What voting system is used to elect council members?
What kind of power does D'Hondt have compared to other countries?
How many electoral wards are in D'Hondt?
What ward has the most members in D'Hondt?
What party is the Lord Mayor not affiliated with?
Where does the Worker's Party represent the city?

context: While <a0_0><b5_0>local government<b5_0/><a0_0/> in Ireland has <b9_0>limited<b9_0/> powers in comparison with other countries, the council has responsibility for planning, roads, sanitation, libraries, street lighting, parks, and a number of other important functions. <b6_0>Cork City Council<b6_0/> has 31 elected members representing <a1_0><b10_0>six<b10_0/> electoral wards<a1_0/>. The members are affiliated to the following political parties: Fine Gael (5 members), <a2_0><b7_0><b11_0>Fianna Fáil<b7_0/> (10 members)<b11_0/><a2_0/>, Sinn Féin (8 members), Anti-Austerity Alliance (3 members), <a3_0><b12_0>Workers' Party<b12_0/><a3_0/> (1 member), Independents (4 members). Certain councillors are co-opted to represent the city <b13_0>at the South-West Regional Authority<b13_0/>. A new Lord Mayor of Cork is chosen in a <a4_0>vote by the elected members of the council under <b8_0>a D'Hondt system count<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
